description: Borrowed from Ancient Greek ὀργιαστικός (orgiastikós, “exciting”), from ὀργιαστής (orgiastḗs, “orgy celebrator”), from ὀργιάζειν (orgiázein, “to celebrate orgies”), from ὄργια (órgia).

adjectives.description: orgiastic (comparative more orgiastic, superlative most orgiastic)

entries.meaning: Relating to an orgy; uncontrolled, wild. [from the late 16th c.]
examples: Dancing was in progress, or, rather, one of those orgiastic ceremonies which passed for dancing during this pagan period.
